acolyte.jdbc

Class AcolyteDSL

  • java.lang.Object
    • acolyte.jdbc.AcolyteDSL

  • public final class AcolyteDSL
extends Object
    Acolyte DSL for JDBC.

      Creates a connection, managed with given handler.
      static Java8CompositeHandler handleQuery(QueryHandler h)
      Creates a new handler detecting all statements as queries (like `handleStatement.withQueryDetection(".*").withQueryHandler(h)`).
      static Java8CompositeHandler handleQuery2(Java8CompositeHandler.ScalarQueryHandler h)
      Creates a new handler detecting all statements as queries (like `handleStatement.withQueryDetection(".*").withQueryHandler(h)`).

      Creates a configuration property for the Acolyte driver.
      static UpdateResult updateResult(int count, <any> keys)
      Returns an update result with row |count| and generated |keys|.
      static <A> A withQueryResult(QueryResult res, java.util.function.Function<Connection,A> f)
      Executes |f| using a connection accepting only queries, and answering with |result| to any query.

 connection(handler); // without connection properties

      • connection

        public static Connection connection(<any> h,
                                    Property... ps)
        Creates a connection, whose statement will be passed to given handler.
        Parameters:
        h - the statement handler
        ps - the configuration properties for the new connection
        Returns:
        a new Acolyte connection 
         
 import acolyte.jdbc.AcolyteDSL;
 import static acolyte.jdbc.AcolyteDSL.connection;
 import static acolyte.jdbc.AcolyteDSL.prop;

 // With connection property to fallback untyped null
 connection(handler, prop("acolyte.parameter.untypedNull", "true"));

      • connection

        public static Connection connection(ConnectionHandler h)
        Creates a connection, managed with given handler.
        Parameters:
        h - connection handler
        Returns:
        a new Acolyte connection 
         
 connection(handler); // without connection properties

      • connection

        public static Connection connection(ConnectionHandler h,
                                    Property... ps)
        Creates a connection, managed with given handler.
        Parameters:
        h - the connection handler
        ps - the connection properties
        Returns:
        a new Acolyte connection 
         
 import acolyte.jdbc.AcolyteDSL;
 import static acolyte.jdbc.AcolyteDSL.connection;
 import static acolyte.jdbc.AcolyteDSL.prop;

 // With connection property to fallback untyped null
 connection(handler, prop("acolyte.parameter.untypedNull", "true"));

      • handleQuery

        public static Java8CompositeHandler handleQuery(QueryHandler h)
        Creates a new handler detecting all statements as queries (like `handleStatement.withQueryDetection(".*").withQueryHandler(h)`).
        Parameters:
        h - the new query handler 
         
 import acolyte.jdbc.StatementHandler.Parameter;
 import static acolyte.jdbc.AcolyteDSL.connection;
 import static acolyte.jdbc.AcolyteDSL.handleQuery;

 connection(handleQuery((String sql, List<Parameter> ps) -> {
   if (sql == "SELECT * FROM Test WHERE id = ?") return aQueryResult;
   else return otherResult;
 }));

      • handleQuery2

        public static Java8CompositeHandler handleQuery2(Java8CompositeHandler.ScalarQueryHandler h)
        Creates a new handler detecting all statements as queries (like `handleStatement.withQueryDetection(".*").withQueryHandler(h)`).
        Parameters:
        h - the new query handler 
         
 import acolyte.jdbc.StatementHandler.Parameter;
 import static acolyte.jdbc.AcolyteDSL.connection;
 import static acolyte.jdbc.AcolyteDSL.handleQuery;

 connection(handleQuery((String sql, List<Parameter> ps) -> {
   if (sql == "SELECT * FROM Test WHERE id = ?") return "Foo";
   else return "Bar";
 }));

      • withQueryResult

        public static <A> A withQueryResult(QueryResult res,
                                    java.util.function.Function<Connection,A> f)
        Executes |f| using a connection accepting only queries, and answering with |result| to any query. 
         
 import static acolyte.jdbc.AcolyteDSL.withQueryResult;

 String str = withQueryResult(queryRes, con -> "str");

      • updateResult

        public static UpdateResult updateResult(int count,
                                        <any> keys)
        Returns an update result with row |count| and generated |keys|.
        Parameters:
        count - the updated (row) count
        keys - the generated keys 
         
 import acolyte.jdbc.AcolyteDSL.updateResult;
 import acolyte.jdbc.RowLists;

 updateResult(2, RowLists.stringList("a", "b"));
